description.narrative: New global flexibel support to UNICEF Education/ goal area 2 in UNICEF's Strategic Plan 2022-2025. The overarching aim is to increase access to and quality of education and learning for the most disadvantaged children and adolescents as well as strengthen the education systems in low income and countries affected by conflict and crisis.

Nytt globalt tematiskt flexibelt stöd till Unicef Utbildning/Målområde 2 i Unicefs strategiska plan 2022-2025. Syftet är att öka tillgång till utbildning och förbättra lärande för de mest utsatta barnen och ungdomarna, samt stärka kvaliteten på utbildningssystemen i fattiga länder och länder som drabbats av konflikt och kriser.

The SP 2022-2025 presents UNICEF's direction and strategic priorities for the four years to come. It outlines the results to be achieved by UNICEF and key partners by 2025 in the context of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development (the WHAT). It further describes the change strategies necessary for the achivement of the results (the HOW) and the internal factors that support the change strategies and the achievements of the results (the PERFORMANCE ENABLERS). The SP contains a single results framework architecture comprising five goal areas, 18 result areas, 9 change strategies and 5 organisational performance enablers.
Compared to the previous SP, the forthcoming Strategic Plan has a stronger focus on the country level, structural barriers and norms, social protection, system strengthening and resilience. The Plan has an increased focus on children with disability and their vulnerability and rights (across all sectors) as well as on UNICEF's work in nexus, signalling stronger joint analysis and programming between humanitarian and development cooperation for the next four years. Moreover, humanitarian action is integrated throughout the Strategic Plan. There is also an increased focus on gender transformation.
The strategic intent of Goal Area 2 seeks to ensure that "Every Child, including adolecsents, learns and aquires skills for the future". The structure of the results framework for goal area 2 is aligned with UNICEF's Education Strategy 2019-2030 and the Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action, considering Humanitarian as a cross cutting issue for access and learning.
Goal area 2 will focus on achieving progress against two core result areas; 1) Equitable and inclusive access to quality learning opportunities, including in humanitarian and fragile contexts; and 2) Improved learning, skills, participation and engagement for all children and adolescents, including in humanitarian and fragile contexts.
For education, as for UNICEF's overall programming, there is a clear shift towards strengthening of systems rather than service delivery. With regard to equitable access UNICEF will work across the life cycle from early childhood to adolescence with the aim of strengthening national systems to better address inequities. In humanitarian responses/contexts, UNICEF will ensure that well-coordinated Education in Emergencies responses provide access to safe and quality learning for children and youth. With the new Education Strategy there is an increased focus on pre-primary education and early learning, including in humanitarian emergencies, and on education for marginalized adolescents. These strategic shifts will complement UNICEF's core work in primary and secondary education.
Learning is the process of developing and acquiring skills, subject knowledge and values. Skills are developed from early childhood to adulthood. With regard to learning and skills, UNICEF will prioritize foundational and transferable skills, digital skills and on job-specific skills for marginalized adolescents as well as youth engagement.

tag.narrative: 4.1 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys complete free, equitable and quality primary and secondary education leading to relevant and effective learning outcomes.
4.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar fullbordar avgiftsfri och likvärdig grundskole- och gymnasieutbildning av god kvalitet som leder till relevanta och ändamålsenliga kunskaper.
4.2 - By 2030, ensure that all girls and boys have access to quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education so that they are ready for primary education.
4.2 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla flickor och pojkar har tillgång till förskola av god kvalitet som ger omvårdnad och förbereder dem för att börja grundskolan.
4.3 - By 2030, ensure equal access for all women and men to affordable and quality technical, vocational and tertiary education, including university.
4.3 - Senast 2030 säkerställa alla kvinnor och män lika tillgång till yrkesutbildning och eftergymnasial utbildning, inklusive högskoleutbildning, av god kvalitet till en överkomlig kostnad.
4.6 - By 2030, ensure that all youth and a substantial proportion of adults, both men and women, achieve literacy and numeracy.
4.6 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla ungdomar och en väsentlig andel av alla vuxna – både män och kvinnor – lär sig läsa, skriva och räkna.
4.a - Build and upgrade education facilities that are child, disability and gender sensitive and provide safe, non-violent, inclusive and effective learning environments for all.

4.a - Bygga och förbättra utbildningsmiljöer som är anpassade för barn och personer med funktionsnedsättning, samt tar hänsyn till jämställdhetsaspekter och därmed erbjuder en trygg, fredlig, inkluderande och ändamålsenlig lärandemiljö för alla.

4.c - By 2030, substantially increase the supply of qualified teachers, including through international cooperation for teacher training in developing countries, especially least developed countries and small island developing States.

4.c - Till 2030 väsentligen öka tillgången på utbildade lärare, bland annat genom internationellt samarbete kring lärarutbildning i utvecklingsländerna, särskilt de minst utvecklade länderna och små önationer under utveckling.
